funding-group.funding-statement: This research was supported by funding from the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (grant number 410-2011-2765, EL, http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca/home-accueil-eng.aspx), the Fonds de Recherche du Québec - Société et Culture (grant number 2012-NP-162717, EL, http://www.frqsc.gouv.qc.ca/), the Skoll Global Threats Fund (JM, http://www.skollglobalthreats.org/), the Energy Foundation (JM, http://www.ef.org/), and the Grantham Foundation for the Protection of the Environment (JM, http://www.granthamfoundation.org/). Additionally, funding for individual survey waves was previously provided by the Ministère des Relations internationales et de la francophonie ( http://www.mrif.gouv.qc.ca/en/), the Chaire d’études politiques et économiques américaines ( http://cerium.umontreal.ca/recherche/unites-de-recherche/chaire-detudes-politiques-et-economiques-americaines-cepea/), l’Institut de l’énergie Trottier ( http://www.polymtl.ca/iet/en/), Sustainable Prosperity ( http://www.sustainableprosperity.ca/), Canada 2020 ( http://canada2020.ca/), and the Public Policy Forum ( http://www.ppforum.ca/). The costs of publishing this article as an open-access publication were covered by the University of California Santa Barbara (UCSB) Open Access Fund ( http://www.library.ucsb.edu/scholarly-communication/ucsb-open-access-fund).
